question:
Which of the following Rajiv Gandhi National Sadbhavana Awards was conferred on Ustad Amjad Ali Khan?

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:
Ustad Amjad Ali Khan was conferred the 21st Rajiv Gandhi National Sadbhavana Award on 20th August 2013, which marks the birth anniversary of Rajiv Gandhi. This award is presented by the All India Congress Committee (AICC) to honor individuals for their outstanding contribution towards promoting peace, communal harmony, and national integration. He was awarded for his commitment to unity through the power of music.

Additional Information about Ustad Amjad Ali Khan:

  • Renowned Sarod maestro of India.
  • Born in 1945 in Gwalior, Madhya Pradesh.
  • Belongs to the prestigious Bangash lineage of classical musicians.
  • Founded the Sarod Ghar Museum in Gwalior.
  • Honored with Padma Vibhushan (2001), Padma Bhushan (1991), and Padma Shri (1975).
  • Performed at prestigious venues like Carnegie Hall, Royal Albert Hall, and Kennedy Center.
  • His sons, Amaan Ali Bangash and Ayaan Ali Bangash, are also prominent Sarod players.
  • Known globally for spreading the message of peace through classical music.

question:
Ustad Vilayat Ali Khan is a maestro in ________.

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Ustad Vilayat Ali Khan was a legendary Sitar maestro.
  • Belonged to the Etawah (Imdadkhani) Gharana.
  • Pioneered the gayaki ang style (vocal style) in sitar playing.
  • Born in 1928 in Gouripur, East Bengal (now Bangladesh).
  • Son of Ustad Enayat Khan and brother of Imrat Khan (Surbahar player).
  • Declined prestigious awards like Padma Shri, Padma Bhushan, Padma Vibhushan.
  • Passed away in 2004, left a lasting legacy in Indian classical music.

question:
__________ is often touted as Tansen of the 20th century, this musical genius blended the best of classical music and created a unique style of his own.

option_1: Ustad Ali Baksh Khan
option_3: Bade Ghulam Ali Khan

  • He popularized many classical forms like Khyal, Thumri, and Dadra.
  • Bade Ghulam Ali Khan’s contribution greatly enriched Indian classical music in the 20th century.
  • He received prestigious awards like Padma Bhushan and Sangeet Natak Akademi Award.

question:
Alla Rakha is famous for playing which of the following musical instruments?

question:
Pandit Ram Narayan was associated with which of the following musical instruments?

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:

question:
By which of the following state governments is the Tansen Music Festival organised?

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Tansen Music Festival, also known as Tansen Sangeet Samaroh, is organized annually by the Government of Madhya Pradesh.
  • The festival is held in Gwalior, at the Tansen Tomb in Behat village, during the month of December.
  • It is a tribute to the legendary Hindustani classical musician Tansen, who was one of the nine jewels (Navaratnas) in the court of Mughal Emperor Akbar.
  • The event features performances by renowned classical musicians from across India, showcasing both vocal and instrumental music.
  • The festival is organized by the Ustad Alauddin Khan Kala Evam Sangeet Academy, under the Department of Culture, Government of Madhya Pradesh.
  • It is one of the longest-running classical music festivals in India, celebrated since the 1930s.
  • The festival includes the presentation of the Tansen Samman, a prestigious award recognizing outstanding contributions to Hindustani classical music.

question:
Which musical instrument is played by Yella Venkateswara Rao, an Indian classical musician and percussionist?

SSC GD 2025 T-1
solution:
Yella Venkateswara Rao is a renowned Indian classical musician and percussionist, best known for playing the Mridangam, a primary percussion instrument in Carnatic classical music. He began performing at a very young age and is recognized for his solo mridangam performances, which were rare in his time. He contributed immensely to elevating the status of the Mridangam from an accompanying instrument to a solo performance art.

  • Rao received the Padma Shri in 2008 for his contribution to Indian music.
  • He is also known for his compositions and teaching legacy in rhythm and mridangam.
  • His efforts have helped preserve and popularise traditional percussion music globally.

question:
Ramnad V. Raghavan was associated with which of the following musical instruments?

SSC GD 2025 T-1
solution:
Ramnad V. Raghavan was a distinguished Indian Carnatic percussionist, best known for his mastery in playing the Mridangam, a principal rhythmic instrument in South Indian classical music.
  • He belonged to the famous Ramnad music lineage of Tamil Nadu.
  • He served as a faculty member at Wesleyan University (USA), where he trained many international students in Mridangam.
  • Raghavan significantly contributed to the global recognition of the Mridangam as a solo and accompanying instrument.
  • He was the younger brother of violin maestro Ramnad Krishnan.

question:
Jagjit Singh was associated with which of the following fields of music?

SSC GD 2025 T-1
solution:

question:
Sikkil Mala Chandrasekhar is associated with which of the following musical instruments?

SSC GD 2025 T-1
solution:

question:
Buddhadev Dasgupta is famous for playing which of the following musical instruments?

question:
Padma Bhushan awardee, Ustad Sabri Khan played which of the following musical instruments?

SSC CGL 2024 T-1

question:

solution:

question:
Annapurna Devi is associated with which of the following musical instruments?

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Annapurna Devi was a legendary player of the Surbahar, a bass version of the sitar.

question:
Tarun Bhattacharya, who was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 2018, is known for playing which musical instrument?

solution:

question:
Which Indian musician and sitar player is the founder of the National Orchestra of India?

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:

question:
Which Indian singer wrote ‘Raag Sarita’?

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:

question:
Indian classical singer, Kesarbai Kerkar belonged to which of the following gharanas?

SSC MTS 2024
solution:
• Kesarbai Kerkar was a renowned vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana, known for its complex ragas and strict adherence to classical grammar.
  • She was a disciple of Ustad Alladiya Khan, the founder of this gharana.
  • She received the Padma Bhushan in 1969 for her outstanding contribution to Hindustani classical music.
  • A recording of her performance, “Jaat Kahan Ho”, was included on the Voyager Golden Record sent into space by NASA in 1977, making her voice immortal in space history.

Other gharanas and notable singers:

  • Benaras Gharana – Girija Devi (Thumri exponent)
  • Delhi Gharana – Ustad Tanras Khan (renowned vocalist)
  • Agra Gharana – Ustad Faiyaz Khan (Dhrupad & Khayal exponent)

question:
Who was the progenitor of the prolific Jaipur-Atrauli gharana?

SSC MTS 2024
option_2: Ustad Ali Akbar Khan
option_4: Ustad Mustaq Ali Khan
solution:
• Ustad Alladiya Khan is the founder (progenitor) of the renowned Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana, a major gharana in Hindustani classical music.
  • He developed this gharana in the late 19th and early 20th century, known for its complex ragas, intricate taans, and use of rare ragas.
  • The gharana focuses heavily on layakari (rhythmic play) and meend (glides), maintaining both aesthetic depth and technical brilliance.
  • Notable disciples of this gharana include Kesarbai Kerkar, Mallikarjun Mansur, and Kumar Gandharva.

Other options:

  • Ustad Vilayat Khan – A maestro of the sitar, associated with the Imdadkhani gharana.
  • Ustad Ali Akbar Khan – Legendary sarod player, son of Ustad Allauddin Khan, from the Maihar gharana.
  • Ustad Mustaq Ali Khan – Noted sitar player of the Senia Gharana.

question:
Padma Shri Pandit Rajeev Tharanath, the famous ________________ player is from the state of Karnataka.

SSC MTS 2024
solution:

  • Flute – Pandit Hariprasad Chaurasia is a legendary flautist of India.
  • Sitar – Pandit Ravi Shankar and Ustad Vilayat Khan are world-renowned sitar players.

question:

question:
Mysore Brothers are known for playing which musical instrument?

question:

SSC MTS 2024

question:
Both, Rajesh Prasanna and Rishabh Prasanna are associated with which musical instrument?

question:
Buddhadev Dasgupta was a famous instrumentalist of which of the following instrument?

question:
Who among the following established the Indore gharana?

SSC MTS 2024
option_1: Ustad Ghaghe Khuda Baksh
solution:

question:

question:
Bholanath Prasanna was associated with which of the following musical instruments?

solution:

question:
Indian classical vocalist Rashid Khan belonged to which of the following gharanas of music?

SSC GD 2025 T-1
solution:
Ustad Rashid Khan is a renowned Indian classical vocalist known for his mastery in the Hindustani classical tradition.

  • His style is recognized for its emotional depth, refined voice modulation, and intricate taans and gamakas.

question:
Arnab Chakrabarty is associated with which of the following musical instruments?

solution:

question:
Which singer of Carnatic music was given the title of 'Bombay' by the people of Tamil Nadu?

SSC GD 2025 T-1
solution:

  • Her music blends classical depth with emotional expression, and she has performed globally across prestigious venues.
  • She was awarded the Padma Shri in 2021 and the Sangeetha Kalanidhi in 2023, one of the highest honors in Carnatic music.

question:
Sangeet Natak Akademy Awardee Sulochana Chavan was a famous ________ singer.

solution:

  • Her Lavani songs brought this art form to the mainstream and inspired many younger artists.

question:
The renowned ghazal singer Girija Devi was born in ________.

question:
Which playback singer was honoured with the Nightingale of Asia Award in 1987?

solution:

question:
Which singer from Assam was posthumously awarded the Bharat Ratna in 2019?

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:

question:
AR Rehman, Gulzar and _____ won the 52nd annual Grammy Award for the best motion picture song ‘Jai ho’.

question:
Gangu bai Hangal and Prabha Atre were exponents of the ___________ Gharana.

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:

    • Known for slow elaboration of ragas (Vilambit laya)
    • Emphasis on melodic purity (swara shuddhata)
  • Gangubai Hangal:
    • Padma Bhushan – 1971
    • Padma Vibhushan – 2002
  • Prabha Atre:
    • Padma Shri – 1990
    • Padma Bhushan – 2002
    • Sangeet Natak Akademi Award – 1991
  • Both artists significantly contributed to the preservation and promotion of Hindustani classical music globally.

question:
Ali Akbar Khan was associated with which of the following gharanas?

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Ustad Ali Akbar Khan was a legendary Sarod maestro and a key figure in Indian classical music.
  • He belonged to the Maihar Gharana, which was founded by his father Ustad Allauddin Khan.
  • Maihar Gharana is known for:
    • Integration of instrumental and vocal techniques
    • Emphasis on compositional variety and discipline in raga structure
  • Ali Akbar Khan was honored with:
    • Padma Bhushan – 1967
    • Padma Vibhushan – 1989
  • He established the Ali Akbar College of Music in California (USA) to promote Indian classical music internationally.

question:
Ishwari Prasad is credited to have introduced the ________ Gharana of Kathak.

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:

    • Emphasis on grace, expression (bhava), and storytelling (abhinaya)
    • Strong connection to Nawabs of Awadh, especially Wajid Ali Shah
  • Ishwari Prasad passed the art to his descendants, and the tradition continued for generations.
  • This Gharana has produced stalwarts like Birju Maharaj, Bindadin Maharaj, and Achhan Maharaj.

question:
With which of the following states is the Bhatiali folk music, which is mostly sung by the fishermen, associated?

SSC CHSL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Bhatiali is a traditional form of folk music in India.
  • It is mostly sung by boatmen and fishermen while sailing down the rivers.
  • The songs reflect themes of longing, nature, and the river, often sung solo.
  • This genre of music is deeply rooted in the culture of West Bengal, especially along the Ganges and Brahmaputra rivers.
  • Hence, West Bengal is the correct associated state.

question:
Who is known as the ‘Father of Carnatic Music’?

SSC CHSL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Purandara Dasa is widely regarded as the ‘Father of Carnatic Music’.
  • He systematised the teaching methods of Carnatic music through structured lessons.
  • He introduced basic exercises like Sarali Varisai, Janta Varisai, and Alankaras, which are still followed today.
  • He composed thousands of devotional songs, mainly in Kannada.
  • His contributions laid the foundation of Carnatic classical music as we know it today.

question:
Which folk music is based on the Mahabharata with Bhima portrayed as hero?

SSC CHSL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Pandavani is a folk music and narrative style that revolves around stories from the Mahabharata.
  • In Pandavani performances, Bhima is usually portrayed as the central heroic character.
  • It is especially popular in Chhattisgarh and parts of Madhya Pradesh and Odisha.
  • The performance includes singing, narration, and dramatic gestures, often accompanied by traditional instruments like tambura.
  • Teejan Bai, a renowned exponent, popularized this art form on national and international stages.

question:
Which folk music of Jammu and Kashmir is sung in wedding ceremonies?

SSC CHSL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Wanawun is a traditional folk music form from Jammu and Kashmir.
  • It is performed during wedding ceremonies, especially by women.
  • The songs focus on blessings, happiness, and good wishes for the bride and groom.
  • This form of music is a symbol of Kashmiri cultural traditions and is passed down through generations.

Other options:

  • Panihari: Folk music of Rajasthan, sung by women while fetching water.
  • Alha: Ballad form of Bundelkhand region, based on heroic tales from the Mahabharata era.
  • Baul: Spiritual folk music from West Bengal, performed by wandering minstrels.

question:
Ustad Zia Mohiuddin Dagar was a ___________ player of profound depth, favouring sparse and slow realisations of ragas.

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Ustad Zia Mohiuddin Dagar was a legendary Rudra Veena player, associated with Dhrupad music tradition.
  • He belonged to the Dagar Gharana, which is known for preserving the oldest form of Hindustani classical music.
  • His playing style was known for its meditative depth, emphasizing slow and detailed exploration of ragas.
  • He is credited with reviving Rudra Veena performance as a solo instrument in modern times.
  • He was also a teacher and mentor to many Indian and international students.

question:
'Sange Meel Se Mulaqat' is the documentary of which famous musician?

SSC MTS 2024
solution:
• 'Sange Meel Se Mulaqat' is a celebrated documentary film on Ustad Bismillah Khan, the legendary shehnai maestro of India.
  • The title means “Meeting at the Milestone”, symbolizing his milestone contributions to Indian classical music.
  • Directed by Gulzar, this documentary captures Bismillah Khan’s musical journey, life, and philosophy.
  • Bismillah Khan was a Bharat Ratna awardee (2001) and is credited with bringing the shehnai to the center stage of Indian classical performance.

Other options:

  • MS Gopalakrishnan – Renowned for his violin performances in both Carnatic and Hindustani styles.
  • Hari Prasad Chaurasia – Famous bansuri (flute) player in the Hindustani classical tradition.
  • Zakir Hussain – Internationally acclaimed tabla virtuoso.

question:
In 1974, MS Subbulakshmi became the first Indian musician to win _____________.

SSC MTS 2024
solution:
• MS Subbulakshmi, the legendary Carnatic vocalist, became the first Indian musician to be awarded the Ramon Magsaysay Award in 1974.
  • The Ramon Magsaysay Award, often considered Asia’s Nobel Prize, was given to her for public service through music, recognizing her contribution in promoting Indian classical music and culture globally.
  • She is also the first Indian musician to perform at the United Nations in 1966.
  • She was later awarded the Bharat Ratna in 1998.

Other options:

  • Grammy Award – No Indian won this for classical vocal music in 1974.
  • Right Livelihood Award – Known as the 'Alternative Nobel'; awarded to Indian environmentalists later, not MS Subbulakshmi.
  • Pulitzer Prize – Focuses on journalism and literature, not awarded to Indian musicians.
